page.title: 06BERKSHIRE AGRICULTURE
page.content: There are several farms in our block, although the number has not changed greatly in recent years. They are mainly arable farms, with crops like field peas, oats, barley and wheat. In the past farms were much more mixed and less specialised. Much more machinery is now used, and not so many people are needed to work on the farms. There are some grazing lands for sheep in our area, although not so much as there used to be. There are a few small herds of pedigree cattle, including Red Polls and Dexters. The largest farming event in the area is the Newbury Agricultural Show, which is held in September. It is a two day show and people come from all over the country to enjoy it. In 1984 the show committee bought land opposite Priors Court to provide a permanent site.
